text: AirPower will come out before the 2018 iPhone event

text: AirPower will come out the first week of December 2018
full-pick-text: AirPower will come out the first week of December 2018

text: AirTags unveiled
full-pick-text: AirTags unveiled

text: An iPhone Pro with Apple Pencil support, 2 Apple Pencils
full-pick-text: An iPhone Pro with Apple Pencil support, 2 Apple Pencils
notes:
• "2 Apple Pencils: the standard and a short one that supports the iPhone and iPad mini"
  • During grading, Federico proposes what will become Risky Picks, including 2 points for correct picks and losing a point for being wrong, as Myke describes how he wanted to go big with this pick.

text: Another variant of over-ear headphones will be released
full-pick-text: Another variant of over-ear headphones will be released
notes: • Technically Apple wasn't specified, but of course that wasn't the intent.

text: Apple announces a multi-device charger that looks a lot like AirPower, without designated charging targets
full-pick-text: Apple announces a multi-device charger that looks a lot like AirPower, without designated charging targets
notes: • Stephen came to the table with two picks: "Apple announces a multi-device charger that looks a lot like AirPower" and "The 15 Pro Max weighs within 10% of the 14 Pro Max's weight". Myke believed that a 10% margin on either side is too wide to be risky and also that the AirPower one is just a better risky pick with less math. Once it's settled to go with the AirPower one, Federico asks to clarify "looks like" and the pick is modified to specify a lack of charging targets..

text: Apple announces a new display that is not the Pro XDR, launching by the end of 2021 somewhere
full-pick-text: Apple announces a new display that is not the Pro XDR, launching by the end of 2021 somewhere
notes:
• This was originally a pick about the Mac Pro being fully announced, but it was too close to Myke's risky pick.
  • The long-wished-for cheaper Apple display finally came out in 2022.

text: Apple announces an update to AirPods Max, that support wireless lossless playback, to take full advantage of Apple's new classical music service
full-pick-text: Apple announces an update to AirPods Max, that support wireless lossless playback, to take full advantage of Apple's new classical music service
notes:
• Working with Apple Classical is part of the pick, meaning that if Classical is not introduced it will be incorrect.
  • This was edited to be any AirPods, but then Stephen went back to the more passionate original pick.
  • Not a reuse of the infamous DAC pick, but in a similar vein.

  • The idea of an official Apple DAC sparks a lot of discussion.

text: Apple updates the standard Bluetooth Magic Keyboard
full-pick-text: Apple updates the standard Bluetooth Magic Keyboard
notes: • Jason Snell had to be called in to adjudicate this one. Stephen contended that it was just the iMac’s keyboard that was updated, not the “standard” one. To be fair, when describing this pick, Federico seemed to be using "standard" to differentiate from the "extended" keyboard with number pad, but of course it's what's written that matters.

text: Apple will create some new noise-cancelling technology
full-pick-text: Apple will create some new noise-cancelling technology
notes:
• Some sort of thing that they put into an AirPod or something that they tout as invented by Apple, is how it was clarified during predictions.
  • Myke, in absentia, gets the benefit of the doubt as to how new the AirPods Pro tech is.

text: Apple will mention at least one new feature coming to the HomePod
full-pick-text: Apple will mention at least one new feature coming to the HomePod
notes:
• "HomePod" needs to be mentioned by name.
  • The HomePod got a few new features the year before, but not much else before being discontinued.

text: Apple will release a new monitor
full-pick-text: Apple will release a new monitor
notes: • Myke wanted an additional pick to match the 7 of the other hosts, so this was thrown in after the others had gone.

text: Apple will revive the HomePod line with new devices
full-pick-text: Apple will revive the HomePod line with new devices
notes: • New deviceS, plural. Must be at least 2 and must be new products, not product refreshes like a new HomePod mini.

text: Apple won't release any new leather accessories as part of the event announcements (including cases and watch bands)
full-pick-text: Apple won't release any new leather accessories as part of the event announcements (including cases and watch bands)

text: At least 1 more color option comes to AirPods
full-pick-text: At least 1 more color option comes to AirPods

text: At least one AirPods model will support lossless music playback
full-pick-text: At least one AirPods model will support lossless music playback

text: At least one of the new iPhones will support the new Qi 2 wireless charging standard...
full-pick-text: At least one of the new iPhones will support the new Qi 2 wireless charging standard, and "reverse wireless charging" for AirPods cases. MagSafe charging speed will also be raised from 15 watts
notes:
• "... and "reverse wireless charging" for AirPods cases. MagSafe charging speed will also be raised from 15 watts."
  • Originally didn't include the last sentence.
  • The previous rumors of reverse wireless charging didn't disqualify this pick since it's in combination with Qi 2 as well. It's pointed out that Qi 2 is basically just standardized MagSafe as well, but it's still allowed as they'll have to be specific about Qi 2 to count it. Stephen still thinks it lacks passion. Later, Federico sprinkled some passion on it after all by adding a charging wattage increase after all.

text: DriverKit comes to iPadOS to let more kinds of accessories be supported on iPad
full-pick-text: DriverKit comes to iPadOS to let more kinds of accessories be supported on iPad

full-pick-text: HeadPods will be wireless only and they will have no headphone jack and will charge via Lightning or USB-C

full-pick-text: HomePod price drop

notes: • This was originally just "faster charging", but the live chat pointed out a recent FCC filing by Apple which undercut the riskiness of the pick. Stephen added a specific wattage target and also had to decide whether the existing MagSafe puck will support the higher wattage.

• The additional condition is an intentionally risky choice by Federico
  • Ultimately this is in fact his undoing. While AirPods Pro were released to split the line, the normal AirPods 2 didn't drop from their original $159 price until the 3rd generation was released in October 2021.
